support_summary: Dynactin subunit 1 (DCTN1) is a component of the dynein-dynactin motor complex that directly binds to TDP-43 to facilitate its retrograde transport towards the nucleus. Mutations in DCTN1 impair this interaction, leading to cytoplasmic mislocalization and aggregation of TDP-43.

functions.cellular_process: DCTN1, as a key component of the dynein-dynactin motor complex, is involved in the microtubule-based retrograde transport of cellular cargo, including TDP-43, from the cytoplasm towards the nucleus. DCTN1 deficiency also impairs the disassembly of stress granules, which can mature into pathological TDP-43 inclusions.
functions.effect_description: DCTN1, a subunit of the dynein-dynactin motor, facilitates the retrograde transport of TDP-43 to the nucleus, a process essential for preventing its cytoplasmic aggregation.
biological_consequence: Perry disease-linked DCTN1 mutation → Impaired dynein-dynactin motor function → Defective retrograde transport of TDP-43 → Cytoplasmic TDP-43 accumulation → Formation of pathological TDP-43 inclusions → Neurodegeneration
DCTN1 deficiency → Impaired stress granule (SG) disassembly → Maturation of SGs into pathological TDP-43 inclusions → Sequestration of functional TDP-43 → Neurodegeneration in ALS/FTD
specific_effects: Perry disease-linked mutations in DCTN1, such as G71A, affect its ability to interact with TDP-43. [1, 3]
Overexpression of mutant DCTN1 is sufficient to induce the cytoplasmic mislocalization and aggregation of TDP-43 in neuronal cells. [1, 3]
DCTN1 knockdown promotes the formation of ubiquitin-positive TDP-43 inclusions in cells under stress. [14]
DCTN1 knockdown delays the disassembly of stress granules, leading to an increase in pathological TDP-43 inclusions. [14]

evidence.paper_title: DCTN1 Binds to TDP-43 and Regulates TDP-43 Aggregation
evidence.authors: Deshimaru M, Fujisawa T, Okuda S, Nagai T, Ishiura H, Mitsui J, Yoshimura J, Doi K, Morishita S, Tsuji S, Tamaoka A, Suzuki N
evidence.relevant_quote: We thus identified DCTN1 as a new player in TDP-43 cytoplasmic-nuclear transport, and showed that dysregulation of DCTN1-TDP-43 interactions triggers mislocalization and aggregation of TDP-43. [3]

evidence.paper_title: Dysregulation of stress granule dynamics by DCTN1 deficiency exacerbates TDP-43 pathology in Drosophila models of ALS/FTD
evidence.authors: Ueda T, Nagai Y, Kondo T, Ueyama Y, Ishiguro M, Inoshita T, Shiba-Fukushima K, Ishikawa K, Hattori N, Imai Y
evidence.relevant_quote: DCTN1 knockdown delayed the disassembly of stress granules in stressed cells, leading to an increase in the formation of pathological cytoplasmic inclusions of TDP-43. [14]

mechanism: DCTN1, as a key component of the dynein-dynactin motor complex, is involved in the microtubule-based retrograde transport of cellular cargo, including TDP-43, from the cytoplasm towards the nucleus. DCTN1 deficiency also impairs the disassembly of stress granules, which can mature into pathological TDP-43 inclusions.
effect: DCTN1, a subunit of the dynein-dynactin motor, facilitates the retrograde transport of TDP-43 to the nucleus, a process essential for preventing its cytoplasmic aggregation.
summary: TDP43 activates DCTN1 to modulate tdp-43 nucleocytoplasmic transport, ultimately affecting neurodegeneration.
